bug.short_desc: Menu border not drawn on first display of menu in IE7

long_desc.thetext:
When menu items are first displayed in IE7 the border is not shown. To replicate, do this in IE7:
1. Navigate to http://demo.qooxdoo.org/current/showcase/ 2. Set theme to "Ext" 3. Select "Menu and Toolbar". 4. Click on "View". No border is shown around the menu.
Further strange effect:
5. Click or open one of the sub-menus on the View menu, then let it close. The border of the "View" menu which is underneath where the sub-menu appeared is now painted correctly.
Now, if you close and open the menu again the borders show correctly.
This is a particular issue in our application because I have a context menu which is constructed fresh each time, depending on context (obviously!). So the context menus in our app in IE7 never have borders.
Hugh Open the menu

Created attachment 249 Shows partially drawn borders
Circled areas of picture show: 1: Missing menu when first shown 2: Menu appearing after sub-menu displayed and then removed
Hugh

Correction: The image shows:
Circled areas of picture show: 1: Missing border when menu first shown 2: Menu border appearing after sub-menu displayed and then removed
Sorry for any confusion.
Hugh

Created attachment 252 Problems in standard theme as well
I've noticed that this is a problem in the standard theme as well. The image shows some details. In this test I refreshed the page, opened the view menu, opened Printer Font submenu, opened Editor Font submenu, opened Printer Font submenu and opened Editor Font submenu.
Problems: a) compare 2 and 3. The Editor Font submenu had been opened twice and shows a thicker bottom border compared to the main View menu. In addition, the left hand border is missing completely from the View menu but appears on the Editor Font submenu. b) Because the Printer font submenu had been shown then hidden, the section of border of the View menu under the submenu is drawn with the thicker border - at 1.
Hugh

I've also seen a dialog missing a border in the Ext Theme.
Hugh

I think this is a bug in IE. The DOM shows the information correctly. If you can contribute a bugfix it would be great. Otherwise I would hope we could fix this in 0.8 where we reimplemented some of these parts.
Changed target to 0.8. I don't see a chance for us to fix this in the 0.7.x release cycle. But I am open for ideas and patches if someone has the time to discover a fix here.
This is not a problem anymore with the new decoration system in 0.8.
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.

attachment.desc: Problems in standard theme as well
